attributes.title: THIS APP COMPLETELY DESTROYED MY LIFE!! ğŸ¤¬ğŸ¤¬ğŸ¤¯ğŸ¤¯ğŸ¤¯
attributes.review:
I AM SO MAD!!!!!!!! 

I download the app because last night I had a dream that the trump man approached me at a bar and asked for my snapchat.

This absolutely horrified me, because I have physic abilities.... and my dreams often alert me of the near future.
Anyways, I decided that if I downloaded the app maybe the trump man would treat me with more respect if the event (that my dream so clearly prophesied) ever occurred. 

After downloading the app, a blue loading screen appeared and processed for approximately 69 minutes, and as I patiently waited for the app to download a truly mortifying event took place.

A small bird was cheerfully chirping at my window and read the words â€œTrump 2020â€ on my screen. This caused the bird to promptly drop dead, and the weight of its corpse shattered my once perfect window.

The shards spilled into my room and immediately began to swirl as the wind from outside pushed them against the force of gravity. 

I stood up, aghast and promptly had a roaring case of fear-based diarrhea on the floor of my bedroom. I blame Trump. 

Finally a small bing alerted me that the app had finished downloading.
I angrily shoved my tears away and hastily grabbed my phone as I ran to the restroom, my fecal matter still running like a forceful river down my legs.

Once I finally caught my breath on my toilet, I looked down and gasped.
There he was, blankly staring at me through my screen. My dreaded nightmare.... THE CHEETO MAN!!!!!!!!!

*dun dun dunnnnnn*

His awful photo smiled at me and then he whispered the words â€œtrump 2020 babyâ€ whilst I screamed at the top of my lungs.

The trump man maliciously started laughing at me all I projectile vomited all over my bathroom floor and sink.

At this point my body started attacking me from the inside out.

At one end I was vomiting like I have never vomited before, and at other end I was shooting out a heavy stream of brown sludge.  

My phone began to vibrate as I curled up into a fetal position on my floor, still spewing from both ends. 

I heard the trump mans voice roaring my name once more and I shook with fear.

It took everything in my body to reach and grab my phone and delete the app....

******************************************* thank u for reading, and sharing my story
*******************************************

attributes.title: HORRIBLE
attributes.review:
1973: The US Department of Justice â€” under the Nixon administration, out of all administrations â€” sued the Trump Management Corporation for violating the Fair Housing Act. Federal officials found evidence that Trump had refused to rent to Black tenants and lied to Black applicants about whether apartments were available, among other accusations. Trump said the federal government was trying to get him to rent to welfare recipients. In the aftermath, he signed an agreement in 1975 agreeing not to discriminate to renters of color without admitting to previous discrimination.
1980s: Kip Brown, a former employee at Trumpâ€™s Castle, accused another one of Trumpâ€™s businesses of discrimination. â€œWhen Donald and Ivana came to the casino, the bosses would order all the black people off the floor,â€ Brown said. â€œIt was the eighties, I was a teenager, but I remember it: They put us all in the back.â€
1988: In a commencement speech at Lehigh University, Trump spent much of his speech accusing countries like Japan of â€œstripping the United States of economic dignity.â€ This matches much of his current rhetoric on China.
1989: In a controversial case thatâ€™s been characterized as a modern-day lynching, four Black teenagers and one Latino teenager â€” the â€œCentral Park Fiveâ€ â€” were accused of attacking and raping a jogger in New York City. Trump immediately took charge in the case, running an ad in local papers demanding, â€œBRING BACK THE DEATH PENALTY. BRING BACK OUR POLICE!â€ The teensâ€™ convictions were later vacated after they spent seven to 13 years in prison, and the city paid $41 million in a settlement to the teens. But Trump in October 2016 said he still believes theyâ€™re guilty, despite the DNA evidence to the contrary.
1991: A book by John Oâ€™Donnell, former president of Trump Plaza Hotel and Casino in Atlantic City, quoted Trumpâ€™s criticism of a Black accountant: â€œBlack guys counting my money! I hate it. The only kind of people I want counting my money are short guys that wear yarmulkes every day. â€¦ I think that the guy is lazy. And itâ€™s probably not his fault, because laziness is a trait in blacks. It really is, I believe that. Itâ€™s not anything they can control.â€ Trump later said in a 1997 Playboy interview that â€œthe stuff Oâ€™Donnell wrote about me is probably true.â€
1992: The Trump Plaza Hotel and Casino had to pay a $200,000 fine because it transferred Black and women dealers off tables to accommodate a big-time gamblerâ€™s prejudices.
1993: In congressional testimony, Trump said that some Native American reservations operating casinos shouldnâ€™t be allowed because â€œthey donâ€™t look like Indians to me.â€
2000: In opposition to a casino proposed by the St. Regis Mohawk tribe, which he saw as a financial threat to his casinos in Atlantic City, Trump secretly ran a series of ads suggesting the tribe had a â€œrecord of criminal activity [that] is well documented.â€
2004: In season two of The Apprentice, Trump fired Kevin Allen, a Black contestant, for being overeducated. â€œYouâ€™re an unbelievably talented guy in terms of education, and you havenâ€™t done anything,â€ Trump said on the show. â€œAt some point you have to say, â€˜Thatâ€™s enough.â€™â€
2005: Trump publicly pitched what was essentially The Apprentice: White People vs. Black People. He said he â€œwasnâ€™t particularly happyâ€ with the most recent season of his show, so he was considering â€œan idea that is fairly controversial â€” creating a team of successful African Americans versus a team of successful whites. Whether people like that idea or not, it is somewhat reflective of our very vicious world.â€
2010: In 2010, there was a huge national controversy over the â€œGround Zero Mosqueâ€ â€” a proposal to build a Muslim community center in Lower Manhattan, near the site of the 9/11 attacks. Trump opposed the project, calling it â€œinsensitive,â€ and offered to buy out one of the investors in the project. On The Late Show With David Letterman, Trump argued, referring to Muslims, â€œWell, somebodyâ€™s blowing us up. Somebodyâ€™s blowing up buildings, and somebodyâ€™s doing lots of bad stuff.â€
2011: Trump played a big role in pushing false rumors that Obama â€” the countryâ€™s first Black president â€” was not born in the US. He even sent investigators to Hawaii to look into Obamaâ€™s birth certificate. Obama later released his birth certificate, calling Trump a â€œcarnival barker.â€ (The research has found a strong correlation between â€œbirtherism,â€ as this conspiracy theory is called, and racism.) Trump has reportedly continued pushing this conspiracy theory in private.
2011: While Trump suggested that Obama wasnâ€™t born in the US, he also argued that maybe Obama wasnâ€™t a good enough student to have gotten into Columbia or Harvard Law School, and demanded Obama release his university transcripts. Trump claimed, â€œI heard he was a terrible student. Terrible. How does a bad student go to Columbia and then to Harvard?â€
For many people, none of these incidents, individually, may be damning: One of these alone might suggest that Trump is simply a bad speaker and perhaps racially insensitive (â€œpolitically incorrect,â€ as he would put it), but not overtly racist. 

But when you put all these events together, a clear pattern emerges. At the very least, Trump has a history of playing into peopleâ€™s racism to bolster himself â€” and that likely says something about him, too.

And, of course, thereâ€™s everything thatâ€™s happened through and since his presidential campaign.
